captions.text: Must be nice to be met!
Get married and you will be!

- No, that canít be!
- Yes, it can be!

Which station
do I need for Stroitelny Lane?

Cheryomushki?
No, itís not out there.

to the left to the shoe repair -
youíll find your way.

Thatís not it at all,
even you donít know.

Get off at Kirovskaya, go 3 blocks
turn right and there you are.

I know Moscow
like the back of my hand!

I could tell you a thing
or two about Moscow.

Watch out someone
doesnít crack you one!

but Peter I had them
cleaned and renamed.

Why didnít you come by?
Mother was disappointed.

I couldnít, a meeting.
Anya didnít tell you?

- She wasnít there either.
- Where was she then?

- She doesnít tell me anything.
- Where else would she go?

Maybe she came after 11,
thatís when I went to work.
No, she was home by then.

- Friend of children.
- It was nothing.

- Think itís rabid?
- Look at that drool.

Disgraceful!
Get your dog out of here!

- Your dog?
- They gave it to me to look after.

- Come on, show me.
- I wonít go in.

I wonít make you pray.
Show me.

Youíll recognize her,
sheís got on a cotton kerchief.
Sorry, is it your dog outside?

- Did you leave the dog outside?
- Did it run away?

While you pray
your bulldog bites people.

- Is she rabid or not?
- How would I know...

- What about the drool?
- Maybe sheís hungry?

We feed her a ton,
and sheís still hungry!

- Are you selling the dog?
- No.

- That means nothing.
- No, it bit me, thatís all.

I studied this language so long
and understand nothing.

This is me!
Take the first lane on the right.
Itís bad to read while you eat!

Take off the record!
I canít sleep!

- Play it more quietly, canít you?
- I canít,
Can I leave my things with you?

- Donít want to carry them all day.
- Címon up!

- Something to eat?
- No, thank you...

Do you have needle and thread?
Trousers got torn.
Katya, get a needle and thread.

A dog bit him.
Sew his trousers, Katya!

You go get Vanya from kindergarten
and Iíll sew your friendís trousers!

- This is my sister, the beauty.
- Idiot.
Give them to me, I wonít look.
Take them off while you can!
Come on, hurry, Iím late as it is!
OK, you get Vanya from kindergarten,

and get your grandmother
whatever she needs, sheís not well.

Donít talk back,
for once in your life.

A man works all night
and everyone nags him, right?

- Iíll do the dishes, if youíd like.
- We would.

- You here for long?
- I leave this evening.
Pushkin once lived in that building.

- What díya want?
- Howís the leg?

- Whatíd the doctors say?
- They suspect itís the knee cap.
They all died in the war -

- Come with me to the draft board!
- What for?
Weíll ask them for a deferral!

- But they gave you a deferral.
- No they didnít,

I got scared
when I got to the door.
and already told Sveta they did.
Had no time to marry before?
Seen a fiance put it off like that,
I'm not getting married, another is.

Hey, what happens
if you lose your draft card?

- This is the fiance.
- How old is he?

At his age
I was at the battle of Kursk.

- Sit down, Alexander Industrievich.
- Thank you, Iíll stand.

Whyíd you send you lawyer
instead of coming yourself?

- Heís shy, Comrade Mayor.
- I see.

- You expecting a son or a daughter?
- In what sense?

Thatís not the reason,
Comrade Major.
Got a request? Let me see it...

Itís awkward to talk?
Something I did?

- Kolya says hi.
- With all my heart.
The suit? Weíre going to buy it now.

- Ok.
- No, I canít go, I need to sleep.

- Or yeah-no?
- Letís go, people are waiting!

Excuse me, please, are you looking
for buried treasure?
Who are you? Whatís it to you?

Itís just the 4th time
youíve been digging here.
Weíre digging ëcos we got to!

- You guys speak foreign languages?
- Which?

I donít know.
Been driving 2 hours,

keep asking him where to go,
and he just waves left, right...

6 rubles on the meter
and here we are.

- I see.
- I say pay up and get out!
He doesnít know a word of Russian!

Heís in raptures
about our amazing capital...

I think he needs to go
to the Tretyakov Gallery.

theyíre building the Novy Arbat,
New Arbat,

- you see...
- Tell him about the money...
I can understand but I canít speak.

Iíll drop you off anywhere
you want free.

I donít know. If I were you
I wouldnít buy one.

Youíve already got one, and when you
get out thereíll be a new style.
Itís grey-I need a black one.

- Why do you need a suit?
- Heís getting married.

- Have fun while youíre young! Navy?
- Infantry.
on the first floor, first row.

- Itís all right.
- I can wear it to work

- I need something like this.
- This is Sasha

You can pick it up this evening.
Heís getting married.

- No, Iíll buy one.
- But heís giving it to you!

Iím not getting married
in anotherís suit!

Why waste money?
Better to buy your wife something.

- You want it now?
- He has to be at the registry by 5.

Heís been driving me out of my mind
with this suit.

- What for?
- Weíll take a break...
and sail to the Black Sea.
Sail where? Iím going in the army.

- What about after the army?
- Weíll buy one then.
It was for our local journal.
I had flu, nothing to do,

3 pages... And I canít write
3 sentences in a letter!

Howís life? I live, good weather,
all I need.
Listen, she wants us to buy grapes.

- Before weíll listen to some music.
- Itíll be awhile.

- We came to invite you to a wedding.
- Please come.

Do you have Tchaikovskyís
1st piano concerto?

- The one with the beard.
- Ogden.

- Heís getting married today.
- Nice to hear, congratulations.

What do you think
we should give his fiancee?

- We have no idea.
- An apartment.

Then buy Mendelssohnís Wedding
March. Want to hear it?

- Come with us to the wedding?
- How can I be a guest to strangers?

- You know him, at least.
- Not very well.

- Howís that?
- I see him a lot, thatís all.

Nikolai, Sasha, Vladimir Ermakov,
Siberian writer.
Are you going to buy anything?

To Nikolai, the first person
to whom I give my first story.

Rakhmaninovís 2nd piano concerto,
please, the composerís performance.

- Miss, I havenít got all day.
- Right away.

I havenít got one now,
but I can stop by later!
So you work out in the taiga?

- And what would I do?
- Sell records.

- In the forest?
- Weíll build you a shop.

- So, you build shops?
- No, itís a chemical plant.
And soon itíll be done by machine.

At least you wonít flirt
with machines.

So, can someone
with no advanced degrees

but go on expeditions
and study at the same time?

We need geologists in Moscow,
too, for the Metro.

- Itís true.
- Comrades, come on now!

Here, take your record and go,
I donít need complaints.

Good-bye.
Iíll bring you a copy.

Iíll meet you after work downstairs
and weíll go to the wedding.
And then you can go to the taiga.

- And you?
- Have you got Robertino?
Too bad we donít have a camera.

and show it to your cousin,
poor fool.

In front of your eyes -
donít get it.
Forget it, itís not your concern.
Iíd have killed him if I were you...
Youíll have time on your own.

Kill him when you
get out of the army.

Youíll have your own reason
for killing.

You saying
that you donít trust Sveta?

Thatís not what I meant.
Anythingís possible.
A soldier has a heavy fate

- Go on then! Hit me!
- Calm down!

- She said theyíre all unbreakable.
- Forget him.

Hey, you think
sheíd really move to Siberia?
Kick my foot, or weíll fight.

include the Cathedral
of the Intercession,

to commemorate
the defeat of Kazan...
And to the left stands GUM,
from the end of the 19th century.

in that it unifies
8 onion-domed chapels.
Listen how do you get to...

You go straight to Childrenís World,
at the 4th street go right.

- See you.
- See you. Whereíre you going?
To Voronov! Well... to meet him.

- Itís kind of awkward.
- Tell him Iím a novice poet.
Why do you sound so unhappy?

- Can you make change?
- Iíll have a look. Here.
Itís not nice talking to me?

- Whoíd you need?
- To see Comrade Voronov.
They told me youíd read my story
and wanted to talk about it.
The jacks get stuck in the tubing,

The screen can cut into the rock,
you see...

You heard the saying,
if you canít write, donít?

- Itís about good people.
- Not enough!

A writer should get
to the core of life!

If thereís a rifle on the wall,
it has to be fired!

- That was Chekhov, right?
- Donít be funny!
Each character must be true to life.

I donít know,
maybe itís not the greatest,

and my rifle doesnít fire,
but itís all true.

- Truth - with no essence.
- What essence?
People let this guy in the house...

...feed him, give him a drink,
and donít ask for money.

Either they wanted to take money,
or just pretended.

- Pretend to who?
- The guy in the story.

Or themselves. What kind
of good people are we?
So to you, people are selfish?

It wasnít for nothing
the Greeks said...
I donít know about the Greeks,
but during the war an unknown woman
took me and my sister in,

fed us, raised us,
which wasnít easy.

And those who died for our homeland?
Were also pretending?
Listen, I had a love once.

I broke my leg, didnít work a month,
and she married another man.

- You think she loved me?
- I doubt it.

- Leg stopped hurting?
- Itís all better.
last year I went to Orel...

So we had a bit to drink,
and I went to the store...

...had a lie down on a bench,
fell asleep, woke up...

...no watch, coat taken.
Thatís a story!

A writer should really
get to the essence of life.

- Good morning!
- We said good morning this morning!

I was just having a chat
till the floors dry.
I have a project for you.

We want to publish a collection
of young Siberian writers.

- Heís really clever.
- Iím afraid of him myself.

Aleksei Petrovich!
I read your novel...
I donít need the extra month!

Ah, itís you, fiance?
Didnít recognize you!

- Itís hot out!
- Changed your mind?

- Youíll marry after the army.
- Iíll never get married!

- Thereís the fiancee.
- And the fiance?

With that haircut
he looks like a common criminal!

- Donít know.
- Who do you need from 92?
At a concert in the park.
No I just had a question for her...

- What question?
- Whatís it to you?

I just wanted to know if she really
wanted to come with us or not.

- With who? With you?
- To Kachemsk.

- Whatíd she forget in Kachemsk?
- Nothing.

Maybe sheís bored
of selling records.

What records? You can see
itís immortal love, right?

- Why would she go to you?
- Not to me... To no one!

- So you came to Moscow for her?
- No!

I got to GUM, they told me another
postman asked for her address.
Knew it was you! Where is she?

Remember I introduced them,
he took her away!

Didnít have time to get acquainted
and already want to get married.

- heís a writer.
- Get lost, writers,

- Damn, that wasnít too good.
- Chatterbox!

- Thatís how it is?
- Thatís right.

"Get out of here
before I wring your necks!"
You deserved it. There he is!

- donít recognize us?
- I do, good evening.

- Whatís wrong?
- Donít want to bother you.

Donít. I get hypnotized
at work all day.
If thatís how you want it.

Iím telepathic: I order you
to turn around! He will.

- I was on leave, in Minsk.
- Visiting relatives?
So we visit his parents every year.

- You made up your mind?
- About what?
Comrades, we need two more people.

Now weíre going to play
an interesting game.

Thereíll be two teams,
and whoever draws
an original horse the fastest wins.

You draw the body, you-the legs
and tail, me-the head and ears.
So, this team got best time,
What does this horse remind you of?

- Whatíre you doing?
- Whatíd I do wrong?

- He was trying to steal!
- I was not!

- Catch him, heís a thief!
- Youíre the thief!
Hey, you didnít pay the bill!
Get him! No the other one!

- What happened?
- He was running away!

- Are there witnesses?
- Wait, Iím a witness!

- Letís go!
- You got it wrong!

I donít get it
what exactly did he do?

he was in a gang,
or something like that,
they were following me to rob me!

- What gang?
- Stay out of it!

Another gang member
pretended to draw a horse on stage,

while he attempted to steal,
and started a riot to get away...
I donít get it what horse?

but if you donít like it
Iíll start over.

- heís got it all wrong...
- Write it down.
As a statement or in order?

- You know each other?
- Heís my friend.

I find the thief
and they drag me in.

- Whereís Alyona?
- I canít find it...
Heís a writer on a stopover

Volodya, show him your ticket,
please.
You can hold me if you like.

- Known each other long?
- Since morning.
And what difference does it make?

Heís the one drawing the horse!
Get him!

Why are you holding me?
Tell them you drew the horse.

You followed me in the park,
chased me!

- Did you chase him?
- We were walking behind him.
What were you following him for?
We wanted to see what heíd do.

Hypnotizers! Put you in a trance
then strip you!

- Think about what youíre saying!
- Iíve got a concussion,

anything can happen
and it wonít be my fault!

- Comrade Lieutenant, heís drunk...
- Lies! Barefaced lies!
He reeks of vodka. Sniff him,

Youíve got me all mixed up
with your hypnotic writers

- Theyíve confused us all!
- Take it easy...
Just one little mug of beer. Tiny!

Now calmly write everything down
so that we can understand it.
You two sit on that bench and wait.

- We canít, thereís...
- Itís an outrage! Iíll complain.

Iíll distract him
and you go get a cop.
Just give me time to go over.
I have a favor to ask...

Would you take a ride
on the rocket with me?

You see, I want to make
someone jealous.
Excuse me, may I ask a favor?

Weíre on our way to a wedding,
and our friend has strict parents.

She wants to call home
from a friendís,

they'll say, put her on,
and we don't have one!

- Whatís your motherís name?
- Maria Nikolaevna.

Whatís my name?
This is Nadya.

Nothing special,
just reading a book aloud!

Itís bad to read when you eat!
Whatís with him?

- Theyíve put off the wedding.
- What do you mean?

Sveta found out
he didnít want to.

- Wait, howís that?
- He told "Iím not getting married!"

Theyíll teach him
discipline in the army.

- Youíve had the ceremony?
- We did... now weíll get divorced!

Donít stand...
Sit down! Enjoy yourselves!

Kolya, does he need
to give back the gifts?
People gave them to make them happy,

not because
they were getting married

- or not.
- Get out of here!
Turn it on! People are dancing.
You managed to dance this morning?
a girl was dancing, alone, no music,

When people feel good,
you can see it immediately.
They we went to the registry,

then back to the officer
to get another deferral.

Thatís how she found out.
But now Iím a free man!

Itís easy to kick a man
when heís down!

You didnít get dumped
by your fiancee.

- A lot can change in 2 years.
- How did my mother wait 5 years?

- And yours?
- It was the war.

Itís not about war,
itís about people!
and I though you were my friend.

A guy feels bad
and gets his shirt torn...

- You kept moving around!
- So itís all my fault, isnít it!
I feel so bad right now...
that I donít feel like going on.
Not worth it. She wonít pick up.
Sveta! Pick up the phone, itís me!
He says heís sorry for his mistake.

- Tell her Iím a jerk.
- Heís asked me to tell you

- Not an idiot but a jerk!
- Heíll tell you himself.

Weíre going to Voronezh
for a competition soon...

- thanks for everything.
- You take care.

Iím sorry I canít see you home.
I have to go to work.
And so I walk around Moscow
Iíll find a violet in the snow

Art Director: A. Myagkov
Set Director: M. Chernova

Composer: A. Petrov
Conductor: E. Khachaturyan

comments.text:
У каждого своя Москва, но считаю что дух Москвы в фильме передан 100% и да, 
она несмотря ни на что мало изменилась. Люди те же. Нет питерского снобизма 
в москвичах. Москвичи заполошные, вроде как циничные, но при этом 
также легко на ходу знакомятся с незнакомыми людьми  и если что помогут.﻿

comments.author: Федерико Куерин (кверин)

comments.text:
Я шагаю по Москве / I Walk Around Moscow
(WITH ENGLISH SUBTITLES)
I Am Walking Along Moscow" aka "Ya Shagayu Po Moskve" (1963) is a charming 
lyrical comedy directed by Georgi Daneliya in 1963 that was nominated for 
Golden Palm at Cannes Film Festival. Daneliya proved that it is possible to 
create a masterpiece in the most difficult genre of romantic comedy. Made 
by the team of young and incredibly talented artists that besides Daneliya 
included writer/poet Gennady Shpalikov, composer Andrei Petrov, and 
cinematographer Vadim Yusov (who had made four films with Andrei 
Tarkovski), and the dream cast of the talented actors even in the smaller 
cameos, "I Am Walking Along Moscow" keeps walking victoriously through the 
decades remaining deservingly one of the best and most beloved Russian 
comedies and simply one of the best Russian movies ever made. Funny and 
gentle, dreamy and humorous, romantic and realistic, the film is blessed 
with the eternal youth and will always take to the walk on the streets of 
Moscow new generations of the grateful viewers. TAKEN FROM:  
http://letterboxd.com/film/walking-the-streets-of-moscow/  Walking the 
Streets of Moscow (Russian: Я шагаю по Москве, translit. Ya shagayu po 
Moskve) is a 1963 Soviet film directed by Georgiy Daneliya and produced by 
Mosfilm studios. It stars Nikita Mikhalkov, Alexei Loktev, Evgeniy Steblov 
and Galina Polskikh. The film also features cameos by four People's Artists 
of the USSR: Rolan Bykov, Vladimir Basov, Lev Durov, and Inna Churikova. 
The famous movie theme, performed by Mikhalkov, was written by the 
composerAndrei Petrov. The film, regarded as one of the most characteristic 
of the Khrushchev Thaw, premiered at the 1964 Cannes Film Festival and won 
a prize for the work of cameraman,[1] Vadim Yusov, best known for his 
subsequent collaboration with Andrei Tarkovsky.
Volodya is an aspiring writer from Siberia. His first short story has just 
been published in the magazine Yunost ("Youth"), and a famous author, 
Voronin, has invited him to Moscow to discuss his work. In the Moscow Metro 
Volodya unexpectedly makes a friend, Kolya (Nikita Mikhalkov), who is 
returning home after a hard night shift. Volodya wants to stay at his old 
friends' home, but he doesn't know where the necessary street is so Kolya 
decided to help him to find it.
Unfortunately, a dog bites Volodya near Clean Ponds. Then Kolya decided to 
help his new friend again – they both came to Kolya's home where Kolya sews 
Volodya's trousers and introduces him to Kolya's large family. Volodya 
recognised that his old Moscow friends aren't in Moscow (they left for 
south) and Volodya stays at Kolya's. Then Volodya goes for a walk.
At last alone, Kolya decided to sleep, but then came his old friend Sasha 
(Evgeny Steblov). Sasha is in trouble – he was planning on marrying his 
fiancée Sveta today, but he has been called up for military service. He 
begs Kolya to help him. Kolya helps. Then two young men go to the Main 
Department Store to buy a suit for a bridegroom and they meet Volodya there 
(Volody has recently bought a new suit for himself). Then friends decided 
to buy a present for a bride and they go to the music shop, because the 
saleswoman, Alyona (Galina Polskikh) is a love interest for Kolya...
This film was highly beloved by Soviet youth in the early 1960s. Though its 
plot is a bit naive and unpretentious, it showed how wonderful life was, 
gives hope and tries to look at the unpleasant things in an optimistic way. 
The song by the same name from the film is still popular and became the 
unofficial hymn of Moscow youth.
The popularity of this film was low in the 1970s but rose again in the 
1980s in contrast to contemporaneous "chernukha" ("black") films, gloomy 
satirical and social dramas with philosophical motifs. Nowadays it is still 
very famous.
There are new versions of the song by some 1990s Russian rock groups (for 
example, Nogu Svelo!) and also a film remake, The Heat, which was 
commercially successfully but critically panned.
SOURCE: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walking_the_Streets_of_Moscow﻿

comments.text:
2014年9月5日 ドミトリー・ロメンジク
ソ連時代もっとも人気の高かった映画の一つ、「モスクワを闊歩する」が公開された1964年から、今年で50年目を迎える。この映画はソ連史における束の間の自由主義の象徴であり、モスクワを舞台とする、もっとも優れた作品の一つである。ベネチア国際映画祭でも上映されたこの映画に関連する、モスクワのさまざまなスポットを特集する。

http://jp.rbth.com/arts/2014/09/05/50_50069.html﻿

Самый лучший фильм за всю мою жизнь я плакал и смеялся и смотрел его 11 раз

Больше всего меня удивляет как можно было за такой непродолжительный период

comments.author: mralexburm

comments.text:
+ZonD9 В 91м мы получили свободу. И в месте с ней и все её недостатки.﻿
\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\
Я думаю, что дело в другом. Мы не перестали любить своих родителей, детей, 
свою Родину, свою культуру и т.п., так в чем же дело? По-моему, дело в 
современном образовании, подмене ценностей и в продажных СМИ. Еще геббельс 
говорил, что мол дайте мне средства массовой информации, и я из любого 
народа сделаю стадо свиней. Вот и сделали.
comments.author: mralexburm

comments.text:
Это естественный процесс. В ссср была коллективная ответственность. Были 
даже уполномоченные люди по этому вопросу (политруки, или кто там...) 
В 91м мы получили свободу. И в месте с ней и все её недостатки.

comments.text:
+zazabass1977 Ну почему же, актёры Г. Данелия и Р. Хобуа тоже засветились 
где-то там на втором фоне в эпизодических ролях. Кинорежиссёр и актёр Н.С. 
Михалков же в свою очередь сумел создать этот киношедевр, в чисто 
михалковском стиле. Кончаловский тоже просился, но жлоба прогнали - хотел 
отжать по 25 руб. за киносъёмочный день вместо положенных 10 - поделом 
жлобу!
В целом же - ВСЕМ СПАСИБО за фильм! Хранить вечно!

comments.text:
Moscow has changed a little, the urbanscape is a bit more modern with many 
buildings renovated and more traffic and lots of central Asian people 
around, but the parks are the same, the people still with a great attitude 
although in a fast paced environment, and the most beautiful aspect is that 
you can feel and breath the Russian Soul. ﻿

comments.author: Andre H

comments.text:
Фильм на все Времена !!!
Какое счастье, что технологии позволяют смотреть Любимое, в любое время 
::)))
-----
Еще добавка ... здесь ниже говорят за Мою Одессу Тех Лет ...
Так вот в Одессе в То Прекрасное Время ... если бы ты еще и зашел во Двор 
(на Вороского и т.д.), ко времени когда народ вернулся с Привоза, так Тебя 
еще бы и Накормили бы Мясом или Рыбой ...
Потому как если Ты во Дворе, значит Свой и Тебе Всегда Рады, даже не зная 
за Твое Имя ...
------
А в фильме Действительно Показано То Время !!!
Даже мене понравилось как в ЦУМе, делалось объявление за кредит на ту или 
иную вещь, что было именно как тогда, когда моя Бабушка сидела именно на 
раздаче такого кредита и рассрочки .... и было таки шо давать ...
В общем Фильм ОТ Начала и ДО Конца ... Отвечаю все в точку ...
Иногда так хочется в ТО Время, аж Слезы наворачиваются ..
Да, было НЕ богато ... но Ведь Все Необходимое БЫЛО ...
Поверьте и все хватало ...
Да .. может Роскоши не было ... да на машину очередь ..
Но за поесть ведь Не говорили  ...
Отборная Тюлечка и Килечка, такая шо сейчас только на картинках и осталося 
... по 33 копейки за килограмм !!!
Отборнейшее Мясо из под прилавка 5 рублей килограмм  ...
Ананас 1 рубль килограмм ...
Арбуз 10 копеек килограмм ...
И это при средней зарплате рабочего Человека в Одессе 120 рублей и более !!!
Я курсантом в училище подрабатывал ... так свои 45 рублей имел как минимум 
...
Мой Отец Инвалид ВОВ ... Дед Участник ВОВ ..
НИЗА ЧТО НЕ ПЛАТИЛИ !!! Ни за Квартиру, НИ за свет или газ !!! Только за 
телефон !!! И так представьте все Ветераны и Инвалиды во всей Стране !!!
----------
Помню как начался Исход в Отдельные квартиры на Поселок Котовского ..
Так народ вечером все равно по привычке выходил на улицу во двор ...
Смотришь там кого-то Мой Папа Трофейной Машинкой Стрижет ..
Там домино ...
Там шахматы ...
Наш дворник, Тетя Ира (по моему) ... наготовила блинчиков, народ подтянулся 
...
Фрукты везде растут ...
Персики в Кулак здорового дядьки размером  ::)))
От Лафа .... Ни Крика Тебе постороннего. ни шухера тебе левого ::)))﻿
comments.author: COP829

comments.text: I love it. It didn't age at all.﻿

comments.author: James Black

comments.text:
0:27:43
- Робертино есть у вас? (Do you have Robertino's discs for sale?)
- Нет. (No.)
-  А почему? (And why not?)
-  Он подрос. (He grew up.)

В диалоге на русском языке нет ни слова о 'возросших продажах' (Increased 
sales.), и т.д.

Почему такой неаккуратный и неточный перевод? Мосфильм, всё-таки.﻿

comments.author: Vasily Aleksandrovich

comments.text:
Прекрасный фильм, светлый и немного грустный. Данелия показал себя мастером 
и отлично воплотил сценарий Геннадия Шпаликова. Авторский почерк 
гениального Вадима Юсова сразу заметен. Великолепный актерский ансамбль, и 
ведь все молодые, а играют потрясающе. Галина Польских красавица! Когда 
смотришь этот фильм всегда заряжаешься положительными эмоциями.
comments.author: Арсен Агламасов

comments.text: Видимо такой же ценитель, как и герой Басова. )))

comments.text:
Да и в жизни вообще тоже особо ничего интересного нет, так ни о чём люди 
живут - просто живут. А фильм смотришь из-за атмосферы (хочется иногда 
"чистого воздуха"), чтобы на лица нормальные, человеческие посмотреть (где 
их сейчас увидишь), на красивые лица из безвозвратного прошлого.
comments.author: Dron38666

comments.text:
это фильм не о чём-то... это фильм-настроение.и вообще, суть фильма не в 
диалоге с Басовым, а в самом начале: - И у вас всё хорошо? - Да - А ведь 
так не бывает - А вот бывает Это по сути отражение в целом жизни Москвы 
60-х годов. И конкретно жизни молодёжи. Светлое время. недаром на 
протяжении всего фильма светит солнце и дождь опять же идёт сквозь 
солнечные лучи.
